intro: Quadrella isthmensis subsp. mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican quadrella, is a rare plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous forests. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, herbaceous scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
